bibl.title: Dispatch from Augustus Archer Silva to William H. Seward
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

opener.dateline:
United States Coml. Agency
St. Paul de Loanda 24, March 1869

div1.p: I have the honor to acknowledge the reception of your Despatch No 26 dated October 17th 1868, enclosing a Certificate of Appointment of Robert S. Newton as Vice Commercial Agent of the United States at this City.
The above acknowledged Despatch lay at Fernando Po four months wasting an opportunity to be forwarded here.
I have therefore requested Mr Stevens the U.S. Despatch Agent at London to send in the future the Despatches for this Agency via Lisbon from which place a monthly line of Steamers are running.
I enclose herewith Mr Newton's acknowlegement of the Appointment.

closer.salute:
I have the honor
to be
Your most obed servt

opener.dateline:
United States Comml Agency
St Paul de Loanda 24th March 1869

div1.p: I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of my Certificate of Appointment as Vice Commercial Agent for the United States for this Port, dated 17th October 1868.
Thanking the Department for the honor and confidence conferred on me

closer.salute:
I have the honor
to be
Your most obedt Servt
